sentences.en: A gale of laughter went up in the saloon.
A man came to lay the saloon carpet.
sentences.cn: 一名男子来铺客厅的地毯。

sentences.en: Easton suggested that a special saloon carriage should be engaged.
sentences.cn: 伊斯顿建议雇一辆专用客车.

sentences.en: Getting into the aft cabin involves a slight step down from saloon level.
sentences.cn: 去后舱需要从餐厅的位置略微往下迈一小步。

sentences.en: Henry's had been made over from a saloon into a lunch counter.
sentences.cn: 亨利开的小餐馆是由一片酒吧间改造的.

sentences.en: Hidden dangers lurk in every family saloon car.
sentences.cn: 每部家庭式双排座小轿车都存在隐患。

sentences.en: His saloon was the finest in all Wentworth Avenue.
sentences.cn: 他的大客厅在全温图斯路是最漂亮的.

sentences.en: She meant the saloon; the proprietor also had rooms for rent upstairs.
sentences.cn: 她指的是酒店, 老板在楼上也有空房间出租.

sentences.en: The company is introducing a new family saloon this year.
sentences.cn: 公司准备今年推出一种新型家庭轿车.

sentences.en: The launch of their new saloon received much media coverage.
sentences.cn: 他们投产的新轿车广获传媒报道.

sentences.en: The saloon stays open all night.
The ship's passengers are in the dining saloon.
sentences.cn: 船上的旅客在餐厅就餐.

sentences.en: The Tugboat Saloon and Eatery is a must-visit.
sentences.cn: 拖轮沙龙和小餐馆是必去之处。

sentences.en: To beg drinks in the saloon became an obsession.
sentences.cn: 在酒馆里要酒喝,简直是鬼迷心窍.

words.tran_cn: 酒吧；大厅；展览场；公共大厅；大会客室

trans.tran_cn: 大厅，酒吧，酒馆，展览场，公共大厅，大轿车
trans.tran_en: a public place where alcoholic drinks were sold and drunk in the western US in the 19th century
